base_methods.evidence_text: embedding models and neural networks have shown promise for improving relation extraction by connecting language and knowledge bases.

compared_methods.method_name: Gormley et al. (2015) feature-rich compositional embedding model
compared_methods.evidence_text: Gormley et al. (2015) proposed a model that uses a feature-rich compositional embedding to improve relation extraction.

compared_methods.method_name: Liu et al. (2013) convolutional neural network model
compared_methods.evidence_text: Liu et al. (2013) proposed a convolutional neural network model for relation extraction.

compared_methods.method_name: Zhang et al. (2015) bidirectional long short-term memory network
compared_methods.evidence_text: Zhang et al. (2015) used a bidirectional long short-term memory network for relation classification.
Devlin et al. (2018) used BERT for relation extraction by fine-tuning the model on a relation extraction task.

stated_contributions: connecting language and knowledge bases with embedding models for relation extraction
stated_advantages: improve the accuracy of relation extraction

extraction_metadata.file_id: 基于实体的概念指导的少样本关系抽取研究与应用_王泽元
